parameters.name: filetype
parameters.text: 'html'

http_get.details:
using of the http get function required of set options of
``http.cache_dir`` at first! The ``http.cache_dir`` could a directory folder
path to the local filesystem, or a reference symbol name in the global environment
for get a filesystem wrapper object.

parameters.name: streamTo
parameters.text:
A lambda function that accept a url and a parameter of file cache location.
this parameter should run http get request from the remote server and then
save file to local cache.

http_get.title: A general method for Http get request

getImage.details:
using of the http get function required of set options of
``http.cache_dir`` at first!

parameters.name: url
parameters.text: image url

getImage.title: Request image from remote server or local cache

parameters.name: filetype

getHtml.details:
using of the http get function required of set options of
``http.cache_dir`` at first!

parameters.name: url

the time interval in seconds for sleep after
request data from the remote server.

getHtml.title: Http get html or from cache

getJSON.details:
this function works on the ``http_get`` function,
so that the options for ``http_get``: http.cache_dir and
http.debug is required as well.

parameters.name: raw_text
parameters.text:
this parameter determine that the
function return value is the raw json character
text data or ``R#`` object value.

parameters.name: url
parameters.text:
the web resource of the target json
resource object.

getJSON.title: get json web request

paletteer_c.description:
Available package/palette combinations are available in the data.frame
\code{\link[paletteer]{palettes_c_names}}.

parameters.name: palette
parameters.text:
Name of palette as a string. Must be on the form
packagename::palettename.

parameters.name: n
parameters.text: Number of colors desired. Must be supplied.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.text: Either `1` or `-1`. If `-1` the palette will be reversed.

paletteer_c.title: Get continuous palette by package and name

parameters.name: url
parameters.text: the url or local filepath of the target html document

parameters.text: the script text of a required given graphquery

A ``R#`` object that parsed from the target html web
page with given query expression value.

+ clr_template: the html document template for the clr object which is exported from the .NET dll assembly files.
